meanings.definition: To move or rotate around a central point.
meanings.sent1: I turn the key to start the car.
meanings.sent2: She likes to turn the pages of her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken turn around in circles?
meanings.sent4: His words made her emotions turn like a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The merry-go-round makes children dizzy as they turn.

meanings.sent1: Please turn left at the next intersection.
meanings.sent2: The wind caused the weather vane to turn towards the east.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to turn the corner but slipped on the wet floor.
meanings.sent4: Her mood can quickly turn from happy to sad.
meanings.sent5: The compass needle always points north, never turning south.

meanings.definition: To cause to face or move in a different direction.
meanings.sent1: He gently turns the vase to show its intricate design.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to turn their attention to the board.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit turn into a hat!
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news turned their plans upside down.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse helps ships safely turn away from the dangerous rocks.

meanings.definition: A change in direction or course.
meanings.sent1: The sudden turn in the road surprised the driver.
meanings.sent2: The river took a sharp turn to the south.
meanings.sent3: The plot twist in the movie was an unexpected turn of events.
meanings.sent4: Life sometimes takes an unpredictable turn.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster's sharp turn made everyone scream with excitement.

meanings.definition: A chance or opportunity to do something.
meanings.sent1: It's your turn to play the game now.
meanings.sent2: She waited for her turn to speak during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: Winning the lottery was a lucky turn of fate.
meanings.sent4: Taking a different turn in life can lead to new adventures.
meanings.sent5: The job offer came at just the right turn in his career.
